question: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Argonne National Laboratory in Chicago, IL.)  Designed to take advantage of available supply, the 3-fuel mix of Argonne's omnivorous engine means the computer has to solve a new problem dozens of times a second, as it figures what mix to use for each firing, also called this event
